page.title: 19SIDDINGTON'S CHURCH
page.content: On the N edge of Siddington Village is St.Peter's Church.Parts of it are of the Norman and Perpendicular styles with Victorian additions. Between 1792 and 1800 stained glass was taken from St.Peter's to St.John's, Cirencester and the return has been discussed ever since. Each month there are 7 services including 2 Family Services and the 6 bells are rung every fortnight for Evensong. The congregations average 55. Baptisms,on the increase since 1980, weddings and funerals are also carried out. Buriels are in the church's own grave yard. It is costly to maintain a small country church. At the present money for roof repairs is being raised by sponsored events, fetes and concerts. The Vicar is also Vicar of Preston, Chaplain to the South Cerney Army camp and tutor to local Lay Readers.
